ThingDef.label: T-12
ThingDef.description: T-12 Incendiary bolt launcher Module (IBLM) is a single-shot 30 mm incendiaary fuel cell launcher system. The T-12 was designed as a compact version of the standard T-9 Incendiary bolt launcher.

ThingDef.label: M320
ThingDef.description: M320 Grenade Launcher Module (GLM) is a single-shot 40 mm grenade launcher system

ThingDef.label: Hi-Power
ThingDef.description: Ancient pattern automatic pistol. Weak and short range, but quick.

ThingDef.label: TT
ThingDef.description: The TT is a Russian semi-automatic pistol. It was developed in the early 1930s by Fedor Tokarev as a service pistol for the Soviet military to replace the Nagant M1895 revolver.

ThingDef.label: Walther PPK
ThingDef.description: The Walther PPK is a smaller version of the PP making it more concealable than the original PP

ThingDef.label: Ruger Mark IV
ThingDef.description: Ancient pattern automatic pistol. Weak and short range, but quick.

ThingDef.label: Blackhawk
ThingDef.description: The Ruger Blackhawk is a 6-shot, single-action revolver manufactured by Ruger.

ThingDef.label: Super Blackhawk
ThingDef.description: The Ruger Super Blackhawk is a 6-shot .44 Magnum, single-action revolver manufactured by Ruger.

ThingDef.label: S W Model 27
ThingDef.description: The Smith and Wesson Model 27 is the original .357 Magnum revolver. It was first produced in 1935, and was built on Smith and Wesson's carbon steel, large N-frame

ThingDef.label: S W Model 29
ThingDef.description: The Smith and Wesson Model 29 is a six-shot, double-action revolver chambered for the .44 Magnum cartridge and manufactured by the U.S. company Smith and Wesson.

ThingDef.label: Taurus Judge
ThingDef.description: The Taurus Judge is a five shot revolver designed and produced by Taurus International, chambered for .410 bore shot shells and the .45 Colt cartridge.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg 500
ThingDef.description: Mossberg 500 is a series of pump action shotguns manufactured by O.F. Mossberg and Sons.

ThingDef.label: Benelli M4
ThingDef.description: The Benelli M4 is a semi-automatic shotgun manufactured by Benelli Armi SpA.

ThingDef.label: Marlin 1894
ThingDef.description: The Marlin Model 1894 is a lever-action repeating rifle introduced in 1894 by the Marlin Firearms.

ThingDef.label: Winchester 92
ThingDef.description: The Winchester Model 1892 was a lever-action repeating rifle designed by John Browning as a smaller, lighter version of his large-frame Model 1886

ThingDef.label: Mosin–Nagant
ThingDef.description: The Mosin–Nagant is a five-shot, bolt-action, internal magazine–fed, rifle. It is one of the most mass-produced military bolt-action rifles in history.

ThingDef.label: TRG-42
ThingDef.description: Sako TRG-22/42 sniper rifles were developed by firearm manufacturer SAKO. The TRG-42 is designed to fire the powerful .338 Lapua Magnum.

ThingDef.label: Tac-50
ThingDef.description: The Tac-50 is a military and law enforcement weapon, it is the standard Long Range Sniper Weapon (LRSW) of the Canadian Forces

ThingDef.label: Marlin Model 60
ThingDef.description: The Marlin Model 60, also known as the Marlin Glenfield Model 60, is a semi-automatic rifle that fires the .22 LR rimfire cartridge.

ThingDef.label: Ruger 10/22
ThingDef.description: The Ruger 10/22 is a semi-automatic rimfire rifle chambered in .22 Long Rifle. It has a removable 10-round rotary magazine which allows the magazine to fit flush with the bottom of the stock.

ThingDef.label: Circuit Judge
ThingDef.description: The Circuit Judge is a 18.5in barrelled carbine variant of the Taurus Judge revolver.

ThingDef.label: SKS
ThingDef.description: Soviet semi-automatic carbine chambered for the 7.62×39mm round, designed in 1943 by Sergei Gavrilovich Simonov

ThingDef.label: SVD
ThingDef.description: The Dragunov sniper rifle was designed as a squad support weapon to give a squad an effect weapon to engage long range targets.

ThingDef.label: AK-47
ThingDef.description: The AK-47, or AK as it is officially known (also known as the Kalashnikov) is a selective-fire (semi-automatic and automatic), gas-operated 7.62×39 mm assault rifle, developed in the Soviet Union by Mikhail Kalashnikov.

ThingDef.label: HK416N
ThingDef.description: The HK416 is a tactical rifle/carbine designed Heckler and Koch. It is based on the AR-15 platform, with the notable inclusion of an HK-proprietary short-stroke gas piston system

ThingDef.label: HK417 A2
ThingDef.description: The Heckler and Koch HK417 is a battle rifle designed and manufactured by Heckler and Koch in Germany. It is a gas-operated, selective fire rifle with a rotating bolt and is essentially an enlarged HK416 assault rifle.

ThingDef.label: TAR-21
ThingDef.description: The TAR-21 is a bullpup assault rifle chambered for 5.56×45mm NATO ammunition.

ThingDef.label: F2000
ThingDef.description: FN F2000 is a 5.56×45mm NATO bullpup assault rifle, designed by FN Herstal

ThingDef.label: Thompson SMG
ThingDef.description: The Thompson submachine gun is an American submachine gun, invented by John T. Thompson in 1918, It was favored by soldier, criminals, police and civilians alike.

ThingDef.label: PPSh-41
ThingDef.description: The PPSh-41 is a submachine gun designed by Georgi Shpagin as a cheap and reliable gun.

ThingDef.label: Škorpion vz.61
ThingDef.description: The Škorpion vz.61 is a Czechoslovak 7.65 mm machine pistol developed in 1959 by Miroslav Rybář

ThingDef.label: RPK
ThingDef.description: The RPK is a 7.62×39mm light machine gun of Soviet design, developed by Mikhail Kalashnikov in the late 1950s, parallel with the AKM assault rifle.

ThingDef.label: RPK-74M
ThingDef.description: The RPK-74M is an updated RPK-74 which was introduced in 1974 together with the AK-74 assault rifle and chambered for the new 5.45×39mm high-velocity cartridge. The RPK-74 derives from the AK-74 rifle

ThingDef.label: Minimi
ThingDef.description: The Minimi is a 5.56mm light machine gun developed by Fabrique Nationale

ThingDef.label: Minimi
ThingDef.description: The PKM is a 7.62 mm general-purpose machine gun designed in the Soviet Union. It was introduced in 1961 and then the improved PKM in 1969 to replace the SGM and RP-46 machine guns in Soviet service.

ThingDef.label: RPG-7
ThingDef.description: The RPG-7 is a portable, reusable, unguided, shoulder-launched, anti-tank rocket-propelled grenade launcher.
